author: James Joyce
text: Chère Mademoiselle Monnier: Monsieur Gilbert a ajouté trois paragraphes assez longs, plus un examen détaillé de (je crois) pages 117, 8, 9, presque mot à mot, voyez Transition No. 13, à son étude ‘Prolegomenon to Work in Progress’. Avant que ces additions soient incorporées dans l’essai, en anglais, bien entendu, que Miss Beach publiera avec onze autres dans un volume, M. Paulhanne pouratit-il les publier directement en français dans un des très prochains numéros de la N.R.F.? Votre réponse du reste va très bien. J’ai télégraphié à Larbaud son anniversaire, le 29, en le félicitant de la terminaison de sa révision. Je compte être è Paris pour quelques heures le soir de mercredi, mais j’enverrai une depêche de Strasbourg: nous repartons pour Le Hâvre. Dear Miss Beach: I am dictating this in the train to Mr Gilbert between Munich and Stuttgart. My eye got better in Munich. I had no iritis but a conjunctivitis and a slight episcleritis, which I got from an infection. I hope it is well on the mend, but I shall not be able to do any reading or writing several weeks, as the atropine I have to take reduces my vision to about a fourth and I cannot see any print at all. I hope you have sent Transition 13 to Prof Fischer at Salzburg. He has published 5 articles about me in the Austrian press. I enclose a letter from Drinkwater and two photos; please forward the letter to Miss Weaver to-day, but have copies of the photographs made for your collection entitled Wine and Water, before you send them to her also. I think he is friendly disposed towards me and what I am trying to do. I would like to have on Wednesday evening two large bottles of the lotion and a fresh supply of yellow drops. If a registered letter arrives from my solicitor, Monro Saw, please open it and keep the cheque. What arrangement is Transition making for the next number? Has McGreevy written anything? He is both hard-worked and underpaid and if they want his article the only way would be to pay on receipt. Agréez, chère Mademoiselle Monnier, l’assurance de ma parfaite considération and believe me, my dear Miss Beach, to be, your most obedient servant, und indessen erlaube ich mir an Euch beide die Versicherung meiner Hochachtung auszudruecken.
